meanings.definition: The act of making someone or something seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent1: Her constant belittlement of his achievements made him feel small.
meanings.sent2: The belittlement of her ideas in the meeting was discouraging.
meanings.sent3: The belittlement of the tiny ant by the elephant was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The belittlement of the mountain by the vast ocean put things into perspective.
meanings.sent5: The belittlement of the star athlete's skills was evident in the coach's harsh criticism.

meanings.definition: A feeling of being made to seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the belittlement she felt after the harsh comments.
meanings.sent2: His belittlement by his peers affected his self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: The belittlement she experienced at the party left her feeling dejected.
meanings.sent4: The belittlement he faced at work was like a weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The belittlement from her family made her doubt her own abilities.
